alert.note: Alert for Furnas; Gosper; Harlan; Phelps (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued April 10 at 6:21PM CDT until April 10 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Southwestern Phelps County in south central Nebraska... Southeastern Gosper County in south central Nebraska... Northeastern Furnas County in south central Nebraska... Northwestern Harlan County in south central Nebraska... * Until 715 PM CDT. * At 618 PM CDT, blowing dust is occurring from a burn scar over parts of western and southern Gosper County and northern Furnas County. Areas of dust are moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Areas of less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Satellite. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. Highways 283, 6, and 136 are effected. Locations impacted include... Holdrege, Oxford, Loomis, Edison and Atlanta. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
